title: German Bank Honours 3 Ghanaian Firms
text:
17:29 CET German Bank Honours 3 Ghanaian Firms By Daily Guide 
Landesbank Hessen- (Helaba), a German consortium that has been assisting Ghanaian businesses over the years, in collaboration with HB Consult, has awarded three companies in Ghana for excelling in their activities in accordance with German banking standards in Accra. 
The firms â€“ Joshob Construction limited, Justmoh Construction Limited and Wilhelm Limited, according to Helaba, excelled in their business dealings with them which eventually gained them recognition locally and internationally. 
The awards further cited the transparency of the three firms as well as their diligence and honesty under the current unfavorable economic conditions across the world. 
Helaba has over the past eight years disbursed a total of 30 million euros in loans granted directly to SMEs in Ghana for road and bridge construction, among others. 
The board of directors of the bank indicated that the exemplary business posture of the three firms showed that Ghana has a good investment climate for companies to perform even under the current worldwide economic problems. 
Global Director of Structural Financing for Helaba, Joerg Hartmann, who presented the awards, encouraged other firms in Ghana to restructure their activities to meet banking standards in Germany to enable them gain access to the facility. 
The award-winning firms, led by the CEO of Joshob Construction Limited, James Osei Brown, highlighted the immense support that was received from their Ghanaian business counterparts, especially in the banking sector and dedicated his award to Unibank for paying their annuities on time and consistently. 
The award ceremony was attended by the Minister of State in-charge of Private Public Partnership, Rashid Pelpuo, Deputy Minister of Trade and Industry, Kweku Rickett-Hagan and the President of the AGI, Asare-Adjei Among.
